sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The div operator divides one number by another and produces the integer result, truncated in the direction of zero. For example, 7 div 2 produces 3 and -7 div 2 produces -3.
sections.text_content: The div operator divides one number by another and produces the integer result, truncated in the direction of zero. For example, 7 div 2 produces 3 and -7 div 2 produces -3.
sections.mdown_content: The **div** operator divides one number by another and produces the integer result, truncated in the direction of zero. For example, 7 **div** 2 produces 3 and -7 **div** 2 produces -3.

sections.title: Example
code:
var eggCount : int
        get eggCount
        put "You have ", eggCount div 12, " dozen eggs"
        put "You have ", eggCount mod 12, " left over"
sections.raw_content: In this example, eggCount is the total number of eggs. The first put statement determines how many dozen eggs there are. The second put statement determines how many extra eggs there are beyond the last dozen.
sections.text_content: In this example, eggCount is the total number of eggs. The first put statement determines how many dozen eggs there are. The second put statement determines how many extra eggs there are beyond the last dozen.
sections.mdown_content: In this example, _eggCount_ is the total number of eggs. The first **put** statement determines how many dozen eggs there are. The second **put** statement determines how many extra eggs there are beyond the last dozen.
